verses.verse: Then he cried<WH7121> in mine ears<WH241> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, saying<WH559>, Cause ye them that have charge<WH6486> over the city<WH5892> to draw near<WH7126>, every man<WH376> with his destroying<WH4892> weapon<WH3627> in his hand<WH3027>.

And behold<WH8337>, six men<WH582> came<WH935> from the way<WH1870> of the upper<WH5945> gate<WH8179>, which lieth<WH6437> toward the north<WH6828>, every man<WH376> with his slaughter<WH4660> weapon<WH3627> in his hand<WH3027>; and one<WH259> man<WH376> in the midst<WH8432> of them clothed<WH3847> in linen<WH906>, with a writer<WH5608>'s inkhorn<WH7083> by his side<WH4975>. And they went in<WH935>, and stood<WH5975> beside<WH681> the brazen<WH5178> altar<WH4196>.

And the glory<WH3519> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> was gone up<WH5927> from the cherub<WH3742>, whereupon it was<WH4670>, to the threshold of the house<WH1004>: and he called<WH7121> to the man<WH376> clothed<WH3847> in linen<WH906>, who had the writer<WH5608>'s inkhorn<WH7083> by his side<WH4975>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him<WH5674>, Go through the midst<WH8432> of the city<WH5892>, through the midst<WH8432> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, and set<WH8427> a mark<WH8420> upon the foreheads<WH4696> of the men<WH582> that sigh<WH584> and that cry<WH602> over all the abominations<WH8441> that are done<WH6213> in the midst thereof<WH8432>.

And to the others<WH428> he said<WH559> in my hearing<WH241>, Go<WH5674> ye through the city<WH5892> after<WH310> him<WH5221>, and smite: let not your eye<WH5869> spare<WH2347>, neither have ye pity<WH2550>;

slay <WH2026> utterly<WH4889> the old<WH2205> man<WH970>, the young man and the virgin<WH1330>, and little children<WH2945> and women<WH802>; but come not near<WH5066> any man<WH376> upon whom is the mark<WH8420>: and begin<WH2490> at my sanctuary<WH4720>. Then they began<WH2490> at the old<WH2205> men<WH582> that were before<WH6440> the house<WH1004>.

And he said<WH559> unto them<WH2930>, Defile the house<WH1004>, and fill<WH4390> the courts<WH2691> with the slain<WH2491>: go ye forth<WH3318>. And they went forth<WH3318>, and smote<WH5221> in the city<WH5892>.

And it came to pass<WH5221>, while they were smiting, and I was left<WH7604>, that I fell<WH5307> upon my face<WH6440>, and cried<WH2199>, and said<WH559>, Ah<WH162> Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH136>! wilt thou destroy<WH7843> all the residue<WH7611> of Israel<WH3478> in thy pouring out<WH8210> of thy wrath<WH2534> upon Jerusalem<WH3389>?

Then said<WH559> he unto me<WH5771>, The iniquity of the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063> is exceeding<WH3966> great<WH1419>, and the land<WH776> is full<WH4390> of blood<WH1818>, and the city<WH5892> full<WH4390> of wresting<WH4297> of judgment<WH559>: for they say, Jehovah<WH3068> hath forsaken<WH5800> the land<WH776>, and Jehovah<WH3068> seeth not<WH7200>.
And as for me also<WH5869>, mine eye shall not spare<WH2347>, neither will I have pity<WH2550>, but I will bring<WH5414> their way<WH1870> upon their head<WH7218>.

And behold<WH376>, the man clothed<WH3847> in linen<WH906>, who had the inkhorn<WH7083> by his side<WH4975>, reported<WH7725> the matter<WH1697>, saying<WH559>, I have done<WH6213> as thou hast commanded me<WH6680>.
